name: badges/badge
author: Jack Yang
description: Badges can notify you that there are new or unread messages or notifications. Add the new class to the badge to give it the background.

props.name: label
props.description: badge label

props.name: new
props.description: apply the new-style of this badge

examples.name: badges in collections with slot
examples.description: you can put badges in collections by adding child element of link-collection element

examples.name: badges in collections
examples.description: you can put badges in collections by adding badge into the collection links object

examples.name: badges in dropdown via slot
examples.description: you can put badges in dropdown by adding child elements

examples.name: badges in dropdown via props
examples.description: you can put badges in dropdown, by assigning badge attribute of dropdown item.

examples.name: badges in navbar
examples.description: you can put badges in navbar by adding badge element into nav-item element

name: buttons/button
author: Jack Yang
description: There are 3 main button types described in material design. The raised button is a standard button that signify actions and seek to give depth to a mostly flat page. The floating circular action button is meant for very important functions. Flat buttons are usually used within elements that already have depth like cards or modals.

props.name: label
props.description: label of this button

props.name: type
props.description: type of this button. '': raised button, by default. 'flat': flat button. 'floating': floating button

props.name: large
props.description: set this prop as true to let this button has a larger height for buttons that need more attention

props.name: icon
props.description: icon of this button

props.name: iconPosition
props.description: icon position of the button icon. Possible values: 'left', 'right'

props.name: wavesEffect
props.description: apple the waves effect of the button

props.name: lightWave
props.description: apply the light-style waves effect to the button
indicate the button is disabled or not

examples.name: float button
flat button
raised button

name: cards/card-image

props.name: src
props.description: src of the image

props.name: title
props.description: title of the image

props.name: activator
props.description: indicate this image is the activator in card reveal

name: breadcrumbs/breadcrumbs
author: Jack Yang
description: Breadcrumbs are a good way to display your current location. This is usually used when you have multiple layers of content.

props.description: example value: [{href: '#!', label: 'First'}, {href: '#!', label: 'Second'}, {href: '#!', label: 'Third'}]

examples.name: with slot
examples.description: you can init breadcrumbs by adding anchor as child elements

examples.name: basic usage
examples.description: you can init breadcrumbs by assigning crumbs prop

name: buttons/fixed-action-button
author: Jack Yang
description: If you want a fixed floating action button, you can add multiple actions that will appear on hover. Our demo is in the bottom righthand corner of the page.

props.name: label
props.description: label of this button

props.name: type
props.description: type of this button. '': raised button, by default. 'flat': flat button. 'floating': floating button

props.name: large
props.description: set this prop as true to let this button has a larger height for buttons that need more attention

props.name: icon
props.description: icon of this button

props.name: iconPosition
props.description: icon position of the button icon. Possible values: 'left', 'right'

props.name: wavesEffect
props.description: apple the waves effect of the button

props.name: lightWave
props.description: apply the light-style waves effect to the button
indicate the button is disabled or not

props.name: horizontal
props.description: indicate this is a horizontal FAB

props.name: clickOnly
props.description: if you want to disable the hover behaviour, and instead toggle the FAB menu when the user clicks on the large button (works great on mobile!), just add the click-to-toggle class to the FAB

horizontal FAB

card reveal

props.name: title
props.description: title of the card

name: cards/card
author: Jack Yang
description: Cards are a convenient means of displaying content composed of different types of objects. Theyâ€™re also well-suited for presenting similar objects whose size or supported actions can vary considerably, like photos with captions of variable length

props.name: size
props.description: if you want to have uniformly sized cards, you can use our premade size classes. Just add the size class in addition to the card class. Possible values: 'small', 'medium', 'large', and by default ''

props.name: revealed
props.description: indicate the status for card reveal

examples.name: basic card
different size of cards

name: chips/chip
author: Jack Yang
description: Chips can be used to represent small blocks of information. They are most commonly used either for contacts or for tags.

props.name: label
props.description: label of the chip

props.name: removable
props.description: indicate this chip is removable or not

props.name: image
props.description: src of the chip image

examples.name: chip with image
examples.code:
<template>
    <chip label="Jane Joe" :image="imageUrl"></chip>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example chip with image
     * @for chip
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'chip': require('material-ui-vue/components/chips/chip.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                imageUrl: 'http://materializecss.com/images/yuna.jpg'
            };
        }
    };
</script>

examples.name: removable chip
examples.code:
<template>
    <chip label="Vue.js" removable></chip>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example removable chip
     * @for chip
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'chip': require('material-ui-vue/components/chips/chip.vue')
        }
    };
</script>

props.name: icon
props.description: the icon of the collapsible-header

props.name: iconPosition
props.description: indicate the position of the icon. Possible values: 'left', 'right'

props.name: active
props.description: indicate the collapsible open status

name: collapsible/collapsible
author: Jack Yang
description: Collapsibles are accordion elements that expand when clicked on. They allow you to hide content that is not immediately relevant to the user.

props.name: behavior
props.description: indicate the behavior of the collapsible. Possible values: 'accordion', 'expandable'

props.name: popout
props.description: set as true to create a popout collapsible

examples.name: accordion collapsible
popout collapsible
expandable collapsible

props.name: links
props.description: links data for rendering. Example value: [{href: '#!', label: 'Link A', active: true}, {href: '#!', label: 'Link B', active: false, badge: {label: '1', new: false}}]

examples.name: link collection with slot
link collection
examples.code:
<template>
    <link-collection :links="links"></link-collection>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example link collection
     * @for link-collection
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'link-collection': require('material-ui-vue/components/collections/link-collection.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                links: [
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Vue', active: true},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Angular', active: false},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'React', active: false}
                ]
            }
        }
    };
</script>

name: collections/collection
author: Jack Yang
description: Collections allow you to group list objects together.

props.name: withHeader
props.description: to indicate the collection with header or not

examples.name: avatar collection
basic collection
collection with header

name: dropdown/dropdown
author: Jack Yang
description: Add a dropdown list to any button. These button props can't be changed for a dropdown: waves-effect, light-wave and disabled.

props.name: label
props.description: label of this button

props.name: type
props.description: type of this button. '': raised button, by default. 'flat': flat button. 'floating': floating button

props.name: large
props.description: set this prop as true to let this button has a larger height for buttons that need more attention

props.name: icon
props.description: icon of this button

props.name: iconPosition
props.description: icon position of the button icon. Possible values: 'left', 'right'

props.name: wavesEffect
props.description: apple the waves effect of the button

props.name: lightWave
props.description: apply the light-style waves effect to the button
indicate the button is disabled or not

props.name: items
props.description: example value: [{href: '#!', label: 'item 1', badge: {label: '1', new: true}}, {href: '#!', label: 'item 2'}, {divider: true}]

props.name: inDuration
props.description: the duration of the transition enter in milliseconds

props.name: outDuration
props.description: the duration of the transition out in milliseconds

props.name: constrainWidth
props.description: if true, constrainWidth to the size of the dropdown activator

props.name: hover
props.description: if true, the dropdown will open on hover

props.name: gutter
props.description: this defines the spacing from the aligned edge

props.name: belowOrigin
props.description: if true, the dropdown will show below the activator

props.name: alignment
props.description: defines the edge the menu is aligned to. Possible values: 'left', 'right'

examples.name: dropdown with click
examples.code:
<template>
    <dropdown :items="items" label="Click to Drop Me!" :hover="false"></dropdown>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example dropdown with click
     * @for dropdown
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'dropdown': require('material-ui-vue/components/dropdown/dropdown.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                items: [
                    {href: '#!', label: 'One'},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Two'},
                    {divider: true},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Three'},
                ]
            }
        }
    };
</script>

examples.name: dropdown with slot
basic dropdown
examples.code:
<template>
    <dropdown :items="items" label="Drop Me!" icon="edit" icon-position="right" :large="true"></dropdown>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example basic dropdown
     * @for dropdown
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'dropdown': require('material-ui-vue/components/dropdown/dropdown.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                items: [
                    {href: '#!', label: 'One'},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Two'},
                    {divider: true},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Three'},
                ]
            }
        }
    };
</script>

examples.name: icon, and large dropdown
examples.code:
<template>
    <dropdown :items="items" label="Drop Me!" icon="edit" icon-position="right" large></dropdown>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example icon, and large dropdown
     * @for dropdown
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'dropdown': require('material-ui-vue/components/dropdown/dropdown.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                items: [
                    {href: '#!', label: 'One'},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Two'},
                    {divider: true},
                    {href: '#!', label: 'Three'},
                ]
            }
        }
    };
</script>

examples.name: footer with copyright

props.name: selected
props.description: indicate the items been selected. Value should come from value attribute of item object. Example value: ['red', 'green']

props.name: items
props.description: items of the checkbox. Example value: [{label: 'RED', value: 'red', disabled: false}, {label: 'GREEN', value: 'green', disabled: true}]

props.name: filledIn
props.description: indicate use filled-in style or not

examples.name: basic checkbox
examples.code:
<template>
    <form>
        <checkbox :items="items" :selected="selected"></checkbox>
    </form>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example basic checkbox
     * @for checkbox
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'checkbox': require('material-ui-vue/components/forms/checkbox.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                items: [
                    {label: 'Green', value: 'green'},
                    {label: 'Red', value: 'red'},
                    {label: 'Yellow', value: 'yellow', disabled: true},
                    {label: 'Blue', value: 'blue'}
                ],
                selected: ['green', 'red', 'yellow']
            }
        }
    };
</script>

props.name: label
props.description: label of the date picker input controller

props.name: icon
props.description: icon of the date picker input controller

props.name: date
props.description: date value of the date picker

props.name: pickerOptions
props.description: options for pickdate.js

props.name: opened
props.description: indicate this picker popup is opened or not

props.name: disabled
props.description: indicate this picker is disabled or not

examples.name: basic date-picker
examples.code:
<template>
    <form>
        <date-picker label="birthday" icon="today" :date="new Date()"></date-picker>
    </form>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example basic date-picker
     * @for date-picker
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'date-picker': require('material-ui-vue/components/forms/date-picker.vue')
        }
    };
</script>

props.name: group
props.description: the group name of this radios

props.name: withGap
props.description: indicate apply with-gap style or not

props.name: selected
props.description: indicate which item is selected. Value should come from value attribute of item object. Example value: 'green'

props.name: items
props.description: radio items data. Example value: [{label: 'RED', value: 'red', disabled: false}, {label: 'GREEN', value: 'green', disabled: true}]

examples.name: basic radio
examples.code:
<template>
    <form>
        <radio group="r1" :items="items" selected="red"></radio>
    </form>
</template>

<script>
    /**
     * @example basic radio
     * @for radio
     * @description
     */
    module.exports = {
        components: {
            'radio': require('material-ui-vue/components/forms/radio.vue')
        },

        data: function() {
            return {
                items: [
                    {label: 'Green', value: 'green'},
                    {label: 'Red', value: 'red'},
                    {label: 'Yellow', value: 'yellow', disabled: true},
                    {label: 'Blue', value: 'blue'}
                ]
            }
        }
    };
</script>

props.name: min
props.description: set the min of range

props.name: max
props.description: set the max of range

props.description: set the current value of range

props.name: options
props.description: options of the select field. Example value: [{value: '0', label: 'zero', disabled: false, icon: 'path/to/image.jpg'}, {value: '1', label: 'one', disabled: false, icon: 'path/to/image.jpg'}]

props.name: groupOptions
props.description: group options of the select field. Example value: {g1: [{value: '0', label: 'zero', disabled: false}, {value: '1', label: 'one', disabled: false}], g2: [{value: '2', label: 'two', disabled: false}, {value: '3', label: 'three', disabled: false}]}

props.description: value been select. It could be a string value or an array of string values. Values should come from value attribute of item object.

props.name: iconPosition

props.name: browserDefault
props.description: use browser default style or not

name: media/material-box
author: Jack Yang
description: Material is a material design implementation of the Lightbox plugin. When a user clicks on an image that can be enlarged. Material box centers the image and enlarges it in a smooth, non-jarring manner. To dismiss the image, the user can either click on the image again, scroll away, or press the ESC key

props.name: imageUrl
props.description: url of the image

props.name: caption
props.description: caption of the image

name: media/carousel
author: Jack Yang
description: Our slider is a simple and elegant image carousel. You can also have captions that will be transitioned on their own depending on their alignment. You can also have indicators that show up on the bottom of the slider

props.name: images
props.description: image data. Example value: [{src: 'path/to/your/image.png', href: '#!'}]

props.name: slider
props.description: indicate the carousel in a slider-type

props.name: dist
props.description: perspective zoom. If 0, all items are the same size

props.name: timeConstant
props.description: transition time

props.name: shift
props.description: spacing for center image

props.name: padding
props.description: padding between non center items

props.name: fullWidth
props.description: change to full width styles

name: icons/icon
author: Jack Yang
description: We have included 740 Material Design Icons courtesy of Google. You can download them directly from the Material Design specs

props.name: value
props.description: icon value

props.name: size
props.description: indicate size of the icon. Possible values: 'tiny', 'small', 'medium', 'large' and by default ''

examples.name: icon demos

name: media/slider
author: Jack Yang
description: Slider is a simple and elegant image carousel. You can also have captions that will be transitioned on their own depending on their alignment. You can also have indicators that show up on the bottom of the slider

props.name: fullscreen
props.description: make it a fullscreen slider

props.name: images
props.description: images of the slider. Example value: [{src: 'path/to/your/image.png', caption: 'nice image', description: 'really?'}]

props.name: indicators
props.description: set to false to hide slide indicators

props.name: height
props.description: set height of slider

props.name: transition
props.description: set the duration of the transition animation in ms

props.name: interval
props.description: set the duration between transitions in ms

name: modals/modal
author: Jack Yang
description: Use a modal for dialog boxes, confirmation messages, or other content that can be called up. In order for the modal to work you have to add the Modal ID to the link of the trigger

props.name: opacity
props.description: opacity of modal background

props.name: inDuration
props.description: transition in duration

props.name: outDuration
props.description: transition out duration

props.name: readyCallback
props.description: callback for Modal open

props.name: completeCallback
props.description: callback for Modal close

props.name: dismissible
props.description: modal can be dismissed by clicking outside of the modal

props.name: fixedFooter
props.description: set true, if you have content that is very long and you want the action buttons to be visible all the time

props.name: bottomSheet
props.description: bottom Sheet Modals are good for displaying actions to the user on the bottom of a screen. They still act the same as regular modals

props.name: open
props.description: the model open status

examples.name: modal demos

name: navbar/nav-collapsible-item
author: Jack Yang

props.name: icon

props.name: iconPosition

props.name: wavesEffect

props.name: lightWave

indicate the button is disabled or not

props.description: example value: [{href: '#!', label: 'item 1', badge: {label: '1', new: true}}, {href: '#!', label: 'item 2'}, {divider: true}]

props.name: inDuration
props.description: the duration of the transition enter in milliseconds

props.name: outDuration
props.description: the duration of the transition out in milliseconds

props.name: constrainWidth

props.name: hover

props.name: active
props.description: indicate the nav-item is active or not

name: navbar/navbar
author: Jack Yang
description: The navbar is fully contained by an HTML5 Nav tag. Inside a recommended container div, there are 2 main parts of the navbar. A logo or brand link, and the navigations links. You can align these links to the left or right

props.name: linkPosition
props.description: to indicate the position of links in the navbar. Possible values: 'left' and 'right'

props.name: logo
props.description: logo text value

props.name: logoHref
props.description: href of logo

props.name: logoPosition
props.description: position of logo. Possible values: 'left', 'right', 'center' and by default ''

props.name: fixed
props.description: indicate this is a fixed navbar

props.name: autoHide
props.description: add hide-on-med-and-down

props.name: showOnLarge
props.description: to control collapse button show on large screen

props.name: placeholder
props.description: placeholder of search box

props.name: value
props.description: value of the search box

props.name: fixed
props.description: indicate this is fixed search-bar or not

props.name: disabled
props.description: indicate if this pagination is disabled or not

props.name: active
props.description: indicate the active status of this pagination item

props.name: link
props.description: link of this pagination item

props.name: prev
props.description: indicate this is the "prev" pagination

props.name: next
props.description: indicate this is the "next" pagination

props.name: label
props.description: label of this pagination item. This value will be ignored when prev or next props is set as true

props.name: wavesEffect
props.description: indicate the pagination with waves effect or not

name: parallax/parallax
author: Jack Yang
description: Parallax is an effect where the background content or image in this case, is moved at a different speed than the foreground content while scrolling

props.name: imageSrc
props.description: src of image of the parallax

props.name: height
props.description: define the height (px) of the parallax

props.name: size
props.description: size of the circle. Possible values: 'big', 'small' and by default ''

props.name: active
props.description: indicate the progress is active or not

props.name: color
props.description: color or the circle. Possible values: 'red', 'blue', 'yellow' and 'green'

props.name: flash
props.description: enable circular flashing colors

examples.name: circle-progress demo

props.name: determinate
props.description: indicate this is a determinate progress or not

props.name: percentage
props.description: this value used in a determinate progress

props.name: color
props.description: set the front color. Possible. Example: color="red"

props.name: backgroundColor
props.description: set the background color. Possible. Example: background-color="red lighten-4"

examples.name: linear-progress demo

name: side-nav/side-nav
author: Jack Yang
description: This is a slide out menu. You can add a dropdown to your sidebar by using our collapsible component. If you want to see a demo, our sidebar will use this on smaller screens. To use this in conjunction with a fullscreen navigation, you have to use two copies of the same UL

props.name: fixed
props.description: indicate this is a fixed side-nav or not

examples.name: side-nav demo

props.name: label
props.description: label of this tab

props.name: active
props.description: indicate this tab is active or not

props.name: disabled
props.description: indicate this tab is disabled or not

name: tabs/tabs
author: Jack Yang
description: The tabs structure consists of an unordered list of tabs that have hashes corresponding to tab ids. Then when you click on each tab, only the container with the corresponding tab id will become visible

examples.name: tabs demo
